column4: aldipc-> you know how a bittorrent works right? it attempts to connect to various sharers, and they have to get back to you yes? so which part of it you dont follow?
vax_-> dont know if there are settings you can enable in alsamixer

usually portrequests which arrive at my dsl router are blocked by my dsl router already and don't even arrive at my box which is connected with NAT on 192.168.174.24, unless of course the connection was initiated from my box or when I have port forwarding activated.. well I have no port forwarding activated and still these packets arrive at my 192.168.174.24 box, I don't undsrtand why
no, because if it were initiated from my box Firestarter would not block it..
-> dont know, im not privy to your iptables rules, would you care to post them?
I just use the basic ubuntu box and have only added a couple of emule ports and 2 in the 50000 range for another bittorrent client I once used.. that's it
-> nope its not obvious, and your statements are not adequate to see what the rules are, either you post them or we'll be guessing all day
okay.. how do I see my rules?
it only gave me the version number
it only gave me the version number, how do I list my iptables rules?
it only gave me the version number, how do I list my iptables rules?
-> you have bunch of complex rules, so I would expect what you observed, block ports
that is what I already know, I just want to know how these packets arrive at my box from behind a NAT router
